main event: On September 21, 1954, in Houston, Texas, a civilian reported seeing 2 objects, estimated to be 40-50 feet in diameter, moving slowly and making a series of maneuvers, suggestive of intelligent control. The observation lasted for approximately 1.5 minutes before the objects disappeared suddenly to the north.
interesting points: The objects were estimated to be 40-50 feet in diameter and appeared to be under intelligent control, making a series of maneuvers.
The observation lasted for approximately 1.5 minutes before the objects disappeared suddenly to the north within 2-3 seconds.
The observer stopped the car after seeing the first object and noticed the second object at a different azimuth and elevation.
The first object had a straight flight from east to west at an altitude of 52-56 feet, while the second object maneuvered up and down and side to side but remained at about the same visible altitude.
The report also includes details about the weather, wind direction and velocity, and an account of a helicopter sighting in the area.
sighted object: two objects, estimated to be 40-50 feet in diameter
